Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Relic" and "A Tale of Two Cities". 

"The Relic", released in 1997, is a crime thriller based on the novel by Thomas Harris. The film stars Clayton Rohner as John Smith, a wealthy alcoholic lawyer who travels to Paris during the Reign of Terror to rescue French aristocrat Charles Darnay, husband of the woman he loves.

"A Tale of Two Cities", released in 1859, is a novel by English author Charles Dickens. The story takes place during the Industrial Revolution and explores themes such as love, marriage, class struggle, and morality.

Emma, released in 1815, is a novel by English writer Jane Austen. The story takes place in England during the early 19th century and explores themes such as marriage, society, wealth, and poverty.

The Lovely Bones, released in 2002, is a novel by American author John Grisham. Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Dark Places" (2009) as an interesting alternative to "Anne of Green Gables". While both movies are set in the same era and location, they differ significantly in terms of their plot themes, character developments, and overall cinematic impact.
In particular, "Dark Places" (2009) focuses on the harrowing story of Libby Day, who was only eight years old when her family was brutally murdered in their rural Kansas farmhouse. Almost thirty years later, she reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime and uncovers the wrenching truths that led up to that tragic night.
Overall, "Dark Places" (2009) offers a compelling and emotionally resonant cinematic experience for audiences of all ages and interests.

Based on the user's preference cues, I recommend two movies from the list provided: 

1. Red Cliff (2008) ) 
Red Cliff is a historical drama film based on a Chinese novel of the same title written by Yu Qiubin. The film was directed by Zhang Yim and produced by Huo Xin and Liu Xiaoyu. The film stars Wu Jing, Liang Xiaofeng, Sun Wukong, and Huang Yaoming. 

The plot of Red Cliff revolves around a battle fought in China's Three Kingdoms period (220-280 A.D.). The film portrays the strategies, tactics, leadership, and skills involved in this battle. The film also highlights the relationships, alliances, and rivalries between the different kingdoms involved in this battle. 

Overall, Red Cliff is an exceptional historical drama film that accurately depicts the strategies, tactics, leadership, and skills involved in China's Three Kingdoms period (220-280 A.D.). The film also highlights the relationships, alliances, and rivalries between the different kingdoms involved in this battle.
